meanings.definition: To change direction by turning a boat's head into and through the wind.
meanings.sent1: The sailor was tacking to navigate the narrow channel.
meanings.sent2: She was tacking the sailboat to catch the wind from a different angle.
meanings.sent3: While tacking, the boat almost bumped into a curious seal.
meanings.sent4: The company is tacking towards a more sustainable future.
meanings.sent5: Tacking skillfully, the captain avoided the rocky shore.

meanings.definition: To fasten or attach with tacks.
meanings.sent1: He was tacking the notice on the bulletin board.
meanings.sent2: Tacking the posters on the wall made the room look festive.
meanings.sent3: She was tacking the loose papers to keep them organized.
meanings.sent4: The carpenter was tacking the fabric to the chair frame.
meanings.sent5: Tacking the map on the wall helped them plan their route.

meanings.definition: A method of sewing in which short, loose stitches are used to join pieces of fabric temporarily.
meanings.sent1: She used tacking to hold the hem in place before sewing.
meanings.sent2: Tacking is useful when you need to adjust the fit before final stitching.
meanings.sent3: The tacking on the costume came loose during the dance performance.
meanings.sent4: The tailor used tacking to position the lace on the wedding gown.
meanings.sent5: The temporary tacking helped in fitting the pieces together smoothly.
